HippoRAG was showcased at the NeurIPS 2024 demo track in Vancouver. The demo used a corpus of 500 Wikipedia passages.
The OpenAI model gpt-4o-mini powered entity extraction, while the embedding model text-embedding-3-large generated vector representations.
A pilot study at Stanford University compared HippoRAG and DPR on the HotpotQA dataset, reporting higher recall for HippoRAG.
In 2023, Meta released the Llama 2 model family under a permissive license; Llama 2 13B was used for a local baseline.
The retrieval pipeline stored chunk embeddings in DuckDB and wrote OpenIE outputs to outputs/openie_results_ner_gpt-4o-mini.json.
